data.title: Nettwerk Music Group Artist SYML Releases 'In My Body' EP
meta_keywords: Nettwerk Music Group Artist SYML Releases 'In My Body' EP
data.meta_description: Little Black Book, Announces upcoming tour dates for UK, Europe and North America
data.text:
SYML, signed to Nettwerk Music Group, has released 'In My Body,' the followup EP to his debut 'Hurt For Me' EP. The EP features his new single, 'Wildfire,' along with his viral hit, 'Where’s My Love,' which just passed 100 million combined streams, and a stunning cover of Neil Young’s Harvest Moon. Both EPs are available now to purchase as a special double EP physical package called The Hurt Eps.

You can listen to the full EP on Soundcloud, YouTube, Spotify, Apple and Amazon.

SYML will embark on his first headline UK/European tour next month, titled the 'Where’s My Love' tour, which begins in Berlin (the first of four German dates) on 30th January and takes him through Brussels, Amsterdam, Paris, two special nights at St. Pancras Old Church in London, then Manchester and Dublin, before wrapping in Stockholm on 14th February. Cologne, Brussels, Amsterdam and both London shows are now sold out. Labelmate Joshua Hyslop will be supporting on selected European dates.

SYML has also announced additional North American dates in March as well. Full list of dates are below.

From his basement recording studio in the small town of Issaquah, WA outside Seattle, Brian Fennell began to write and record songs under the name SYML, which means simple in Welsh. Adopted and not knowing his history or connection to his Welsh roots, many of these songs are influenced by the complex feelings that come from unknown lineage.
